definition: edge of a tortoiseshell/see 冉冉[ran3 ran3]
edge of a tortoiseshell/see 冉冉[ran3 ran3]

sentences.english: In the edge of the vast South China Sea, a red sun is rising.
sentences.chinese: 在波澜壮阔的中国南海之端，一轮红日正在冉冉升起。

sentences.english: They see themselves as pioneers, exploring the emerging superpower up close.
sentences.chinese: 他们视自己为先驱者，探索这个冉冉升起的超级大国。

sentences.english: The sun was just rising through the leafy tops of those trees.
sentences.chinese: 太阳正从那些树的树梢上冉冉升起。

sentences.english: It seems old is slowly catching up with me.
It's for professional developers and programming hobbyists. A new generation of developers are represented on github.
sentences.chinese: 新一代开发者正在github上冉冉升起。

sentences.english: The old man raised his head,facing the rising sun.
sentences.chinese: 老人抬起头，面对冉冉升起的太阳。

sentences.english: The rising sun casts a golden glow over the fields.
sentences.chinese: 冉冉升起的太阳在田野中洒下金色的阳光。

sentences.english: An indifferent to the moon in the flowers were gradually rising, more moods.
sentences.chinese: 一轮明月淡然的在花丛中冉冉升起，更显意境。

sentences.english: Smoke is curling up from the kitchen chimney.
sentences.chinese: 炊烟从厨房的烟囱中冉冉升起。

sentences.english: A red sun rose slowly from the calm sea.
sentences.chinese: 一轮红日从河清海晏的海面冉冉升起。

sentences.english: I saw a red dawning sun rising slowly.
sentences.chinese: 我看到一轮曈昽的红日在冉冉升起。

sentences.english: S: It seems like you are rising up to a Chinese pop star.
sentences.chinese: 看来你正成为一颗冉冉上升的中国明星。

sentences.english: It is a cigarette-end from it gently rises a thread of smoke.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个烟蒂，一缕烟还在冉冉上升。

sentences.english: And others’ balloons may rise in the meantime.
sentences.chinese: 其他人同时也在冉冉上升。

sentences.english: When they stand at accept award the on the stage to looking at the fresh and red five planets red flag, rise gradually.
sentences.chinese: 当他们站在领奖台上看着鲜红的五星红旗，冉冉升起。

definition: multicolored sunlight of sunrise or sunset
to float in the air/swiftly/nimbly/easy and relaxed
a glimmer/twinkling (of stars, phosphorescence, candlelight)/flickering light
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
